info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 16 at 12:47PM MST until February 16 at 1:15PM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: The National Weather Service in Grand Junction has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southwestern Eagle County in west central Colorado... Northeastern Pitkin County in west central Colorado... * Until 115 PM MST. * At 1247 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located 16 miles southeast of Eagle, or 34 miles east of Glenwood Springs, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Poor visibility in snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts up to 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect hazardous road conditions. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 163 and 174. Colorado 82 between mile markers 21 and 37. Locations impacted include... Aspen, Eagle, Avon, Vail, Basalt, Minturn, Snowmass, Edwards, Snowmass Village, Meridith, Woody Creek, Eagle-Vail, Dowd and El Jebel. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions.
